reviews.review: It may lack some of the community niceties, beloved maps (Assault, anyone?), and little features of past games, but Global Offensive delivers on the promise of a faithful, polished, and better looking Counter-Strike for whoever wants it. Even if the community doesn't meet the golden standard of 1.6 and Source, CS:GO will remain a multiplayer classic for those willing to put in the time to learn the maps and weapons.

As the first game I played on Steam for more than 1k hours, it can be said to be excellent.
When I introduce this game to people around me, they will not hesitate to stay after trying it for a while.
No matter from the playability and competitiveness of the game, or from its unique global market, there are countless FPS games that can't be surpassed. Worth recommending! More and more people want to play, and I hope CS:GO can be better and better!
Good game, probably on of the best available on Steam platform. Valve - good job!
